analyzed: dhamma paccanīya anuloma tika tika paṭṭhāna pāḷi
translated: The reverse order of the law of conditionality, The Paṭṭhāna text with the Tika commentary

original: 23.8. Kusalattika, Dassanahetuttika🔽Nakusalaṁ nadassanena pahātabbahetukaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca akusalo dassanena pahātabbahetuko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: kusala ttika dassana hetu ttika  na kusalam na dassanena pahātabba hetukam dhammam paṭicca akusalaḥ dassanena pahātabba hetukaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: The wholesome triad, the triad of causes to be abandoned by seeing🔽With a wholesome, causally-related, not-to-be-abandoned-by-seeing factor as condition there arises an unwholesome, causally-related, to-be-abandoned-by-seeing factor, by way of condition being a root. (Abbreviated.) With root as condition there are three, … with ignorance as condition there are three, … with no condition there are three.

original: Nakusalaṁ nabhāvanāya pahātabbahetukaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca akusalo bhāvanāya pahātabbahetuko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽Nakusalaṁ nanevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbahetukaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca abyākato nevadassanena
analyzed: na kusalam na bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukam dhammam paṭicca akusalaḥ bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi  na kusalam na neva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukam dhammam paṭicca abyākataḥ na iva dassanena
translated: With a wholesome, causally-related, not-to-be-abandoned-by-development factor as condition there arises an unwholesome, causally-related, to-be-abandoned-by-development factor, by way of condition being a root. (Abbreviated.) With root as condition there are three, … with no condition there are three.

original: nabhāvanāya pahātabbahetuko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi,
analyzed: na bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi
translated: With a wholesome, causally-related, not-to-be-abandoned-by-either-seeing-or-development factor as condition there arises an indeterminate, causally-related, not-to-be-abandoned-by-either-seeing-or-development factor, by way of condition being a root. (Abbreviated.) With root as condition there are three, … with no condition there are three.

original: ārammaṇe tīṇi …pe… sahajāte nava …pe… nissaye nava …pe… kamme …pe… magge nava …pe… avigate nava.
analyzed: ārammaṇe tīṇi pe sahajāte nava pe nissaye nava pe kamme pe magge nava pe avigate nava
translated: There are three lines of reasoning in regard to object. … There are nine lines of reasoning in regard to conascence. … There are nine lines of reasoning in regard to support. … There are nine lines of reasoning in regard to kamma. … There are nine lines of reasoning in regard to path. … There are nine lines of reasoning in regard to non-obstruction.
